name: Kihei Kai Nani

reviews.text: We were nervous because we couldn't find any photos of this unit and so were pleasantly surprised when we got there. It was clean and well furnished. The bathroom has been updated fairly recently and had nice tile and a big sink vanity where my teenaged daughter and I could both do our makeup at the same time. The murphy bed was nice, we weren't there much during the day so left if down the whole time. The sofa is NOT a sofa sleeper like we thought so our kids had to share the murphy bed. A problem big sister solved by creating a barrier of pillows so little brother wouldn't (yuck) touch her during the night. The kitchen was well stocked, we didn't eat in much, but it was still nice. The fridge is full sized and there's an oven, stove, microwave, toaster. Don't leave anything out for the tiny ants to eat.
reviews.title: Kihei Kai Nani Unit 127

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The bedroom had a comfy bed. It was awfully hot in the bedroom and I wanted to trade beds with the kids but they wouldn't hear of it. The air conditioner blew right on the murphy bed but my son thought it was too cold so he'd turn it off whenever we turned it on, so the rest of us were always hot. It does help to have a fan blowing on you at night. If you open the windows just be prepared for the sweet sound of the birds at the crack of dawn. Sweet is pushing it, I like birds but there were some really noisy ones! If you want to sleep in, close all the drapes (I used a hair clip to hold them closed), and pull them up off the front of the A/C and turn in on. There are wonderful trees on the grounds, the plumeria trees smelled heavenly. The laundry room is right across from 127, but it closes at 9pm so the noise wasn't a problem. There's a restroom right there too, so if someone is taking too long showering, you can run over there and use the bathroom (from 9am - 9 pm). The pool is close and handy. It's nice to put in a load of dirty beach towels, and hang out at the pool while they wash. It's easy to check on them.
reviews.title: KKN #127

likes.liked: — Cantral location to the activities we were interested in (Diving, Snorkeling)

reviews.title: Nightmare Condo/Feeling Ripped Off
reviews.text: There is a cooler in the closet which is great for the road to Hana or other excursions. There are beach mats there too, and a safe, which most units don't have. We bought boogie boards rather than rent, you can buy them for $20 most places. We left ours on the lanai, so maybe they'll still be there if you want to use them. There are beach towels too, but we brought our own because we snorkel a lot and didn't want to take anyone else's towels out with us. The snorkeling was GREAT by the way. Try Ahihi Cove or 5 Graves to see a lot of turtles. We could actually hear the humpback whales singing! It's a little hard getting in and out of the water at them, but awesome snorkeling. Way better than Molokini. (but the boat ride to Molokini is fun, we saw whales) Makena beach in front of the Maui Prince is also good with a beautiful beach, restrooms and showers too.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Fred's didn't open until 7:30 am for breakfast (I don't know if this is just during off season or from now on). They have great banana muffins. The ice cream place was good but pricey, $4.50 for one scoop in a waffle cone.
reviews.title: Great place!
Great Condo
reviews.text: We felt safe at the Kihei Kai Nani. The people were nice. We were always able to find a parking place. It's a little tight, but it worked fine. You can walk to lots of shops and restaurants from there. There was free wi-fi, which was nice. There's a long cable behind the tv in the front room.

Really enjoyed our stay here. Our flight was very late arriving, and we were surprised to see security outside checking cars in - very nice! We stayed in suite 254. There were a few minor issues but nothing that completely ruined our trip or anything. You're staying at a condo that is DIRECTLY across the street from the beach... You shouldn't be in your room that often anyway :)
reviews.title: Great stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Check in went great. Used the laundry room - clean and nice.
reviews.title: Would NOT recommend Unit #253!

likes.disliked: — Room #253; The apparent low tolerance for tourists.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Only complaint I had was the various noises heard throughout the night... I don't think people realized how much noise travels in this complex. We slept with the windows open, so you could definitely understand many conversations either very late at night or early in the morning. Not a big deal though.
reviews.title: Very comfortable/Awesome location!

likes.liked: — It was roomy, clean, and it was great having the kitchen! Great location too!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We will definitely be staying at this complex again.
reviews.title: Awful

likes.liked: — Close to beach, restaurants and shops

reviews.text: Though the location was convenient and the grounds well-kept, we would likely not stay at this particular complex again. Our unit (#253) was disappointingly outdated compared to several other units that our party rented. The bedroom carpet and upholstered bench were stained, and I actually bleached and scrubbed the shower floor myself before I dared to enter it. The washer and dryer were appreciated, however.
reviews.title: Disappointed with Suite 214

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: You couldn't ask for a better experience. Naomi and her family have unit 148 in great condition with everything you could need. We walked in the door and felt immediately at home. Not an overpriced stuffy condo. Step out on the lanai and your looking at the pool, and hearing the birds and ocean.
reviews.title: Wonderful Accomodations, Unit 148

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Thank you Naomi for making this one of our best vacations in years.
reviews.title: Great value, nice location, refreshing hospitality

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Kihei Kai Nani Unit (Makamaka ola Hale) - Building 11 Unit 142 - Owners Vinnie and John
reviews.title: Location location location
We Loved the Kihei Kai Nani
reviews.text: This unit has very good owners and their care shines through. The condo has been updated with new kitchen appliances & furniture. The decoration is up to date with nice outdoor themes. The hostess (Hope) is very kind and warm and she makes sure you have everything. We were greeted with a little note and pineapple and chocolates in the frig. The unit even has extras to make your stay more enjoyable including nice dishes, dish washer, boogey boards, beach towels, beach bag, and umbrella. The bedroom has a King size bed and is comfortable. No bugs were seen while staying there for 5 days. A small porch is available that is quite private. Upon our arrival, it was thoroughly cleaned. It is also a short walking distance from Kamaole Beach I & II. Excellent snorkeling only a short drive away. Many nice restaurants are nearby within walking distance. Of course, the unit doesn't compare to the Hyatt or other resorts with waterfalls cascading into their pools. (It isn't $400 a night either) But it gives you a central location to Hana, West Maui, Halelaka Volcano, and South Maui. I would definitely stay here again. This unit is a great place to stay for your money. This

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: unit is pushed back a few buildings from the road (and the adjoining beach) but I think it helps keep the noise down. It is also on the other side of the "construction" some other writers discuss in their reviews. A great mix of value and convenience.
reviews.title: Convenient location, otherwise not so great

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I and our friends stayed a the Kihei Kai Nani for 5 days in May. We stayed in Unit 348. The condo was nice and had pretty much everything we needed. As I say the condo was nice until I saw our friends condo Unit 147. WOW, what a difference. It was so warm and comfortable. When they arrived in Unit 147 there was a letter welcoming them to their summer home and it really felt like home.
reviews.title: nice place good time

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were quite upset to find out that the phone in our condo #348 was not in service. One evening our children calling from Vancouver tried to get in touch with us because there was a small family emergency. Our children called the office and were given the phone number to the condo but of course could not contact us because of the dead phone. Thank goodness we called home that night to find out they were trying to get a hold of us.
reviews.title: Unit 139 has the BEST ammenities and location

likes.liked: — Nice furnishings, great location, excellent value

reviews.text: All said and done, we had great trip to Maui. The grounds at the KKN are really beautiful and very well kept. The ladies at the office were very nice and the guy that cleaned the pool every morning did an incredible job.
reviews.title: We'll be back!

likes.disliked: — Noise, but that came with the great location.

reviews.text: I think we would have liked our unit alot more if we hadn't seen our friends unit.
reviews.title: Perfect Maui Get-Away

likes.liked: — Location and comfort of the condo

reviews.title: Kihei at it's best
reviews.text: Our stay in unit 139 was AWESOME! This is our second time staying in this unit and we will always request this one. There are two flat screen TVs, great furnishings, air conditioner, a beautiful lanai, a comfortable couch and new appliances. Everything you could ever want or need is included in this condo. The owners have a book requesting suggestions from guests then upgrade on a regular basis. This unit is a ground floor corner right across from the pool. Our friends who stayed in another unit came to 139 and could not believe how beautiful it is. We have been to KKN many times and always love the atmosphere, friendly office people, and the great location. Its the best complex in Kihei for the price.

description: When you arrive to Maui you deserve the best and pay the least for the best deal.........Kihei Kai Nani is just that, Best location, best deal out there for this gem in South Kihei Join our stimulus plan from $89 a night The famous book Maui Revealed has given us a gold bar value......that tells you something right there! Call us anytime, we are open 7 days a week 1 877 628 4482 Maui Hawaii Vacations or Maui Coast Condo
